newsitem.title: CHINA: Two brains keep Chinese baby awake.
newsitem.headline: Two brains keep Chinese baby awake.

text.p: A Chinese baby boy with two brains is doing well -- but hardly sleeps because his brains work in rotation, the Xinhua news agency.
The little boy was born in Chaoyang city in northeastern Liaoning province in July 1995 is growing well and does not need surgery, the official agency quoted doctors as saying.
However, the baby only sleeps for about one hour a night -- and sometimes for as little as 20 minutes -- and seldom sleeps during the day, Xinhua said on Saturday.
"Doctors have found that the youngster has two brains, which work on a rotating basis, which means the baby sleeps less," Xinhua said.
